title: PFC among 9 stocks with upcoming dividend and split record dates. Do you own any?
description: The record date is the cutoff for determining shareholders entitled to dividends, bonus shares, or stock splits. Investors must have shares in their Demat accounts by this date to qualify. Under the t+1 settlement system, shares must be bought at least one day before the ex-date to be eligible. Purchases on the ex-date disqualify investors.

title: The role of corporate buybacks in supporting equity prices: A quantitative analysis
description: Imagine a company that initially has 100 million outstanding shares and earns a net income of $50 million, resulting in an EPS of $0.50. If the firm decides to repurchase 10% of its shares, the total number of shares drops to 90 million. With net income unchanged, the EPS rises to approximately $0.56. This enhancement in EPS tends to boost the stock’s market valuation when price-to-earnings multiples remain constant.
reason: The article is a theoretical analysis of corporate buybacks and does not mention any specific companies.

reason: The article discusses foreign investment in Kerala but does not mention any specific Indian companies.

title: Who’s losing big? Zomato among top 10 stocks that FIIs trimmed in Q3
description: FII holdings in IndusInd Bank fell from 39.2% in September 2024 to 30.3% in December 2024 — an 8.9% decline that resulted in a selloff of Rs 77,614 million.
reason: The article mentions Zomato and IndusInd Bank as stocks where FIIs have reduced their holdings, indicating potential negative impact.

title: The rise of margin trading facility in India: A regulated product for smarter investing
description: MTF is a leveraged financial product enabling investors to acquire a greater number of shares than their available cash balance might normally allow. In contrast to futures and options (F&O) that typically offer leverage in the range of 5 to 50 times, MTF delivers moderate leverage of approximately 2 to 4 times, thereby significantly reducing the associated risks for investors.
reason: The article discusses margin trading facilities in general and does not mention any specific companies.

title: Shivraj Chouhan Condemns Air India Over Damaged Seat; Service Upgrades Under Tata A 'Misconception'
description: Air India apologised in a tweet, stating that the matter is under investigation.
reason: The article discusses a negative incident involving Air India, which is owned by Tata, and could impact the company's reputation and stock price.

title: Tata Group to invest ₹500 crore in JV with Malabar Cements for boat-building venture
description: The boat-building facility is expected to come up on a plot leased by the Malabar Cements for clinker imports on Kochi Port Authority land on Willingdon Island
reason: The article discusses a significant investment by Tata Group in a joint venture, which could positively impact the companies involved.

title: Rethinking metrics for long-term investment success
description: Investment horizons typically focus on a short-term period, lasting several weeks up to three years, and include assets such as cash equivalents, bonds, and other fixed-income instruments. Relying solely on conventional financial metrics like quarterly EPS and ROe can be deceptive. Such measures may promote behaviours—cost-cutting, revenue manipulation, and excess risk-taking—that undermine long-term stability. This approach risks compromising sustainable growth.
reason: The article discusses investment metrics and does not mention any specific companies or direct impacts on the stock market.

title: Nifty in lower top-bottom trend since September. Rupak De on trading strategy
description: “Nifty has fallen for the second consecutive week. Additionally, the index has been sustaining below the critical moving average, confirming the bearish trend. On the daily chart, the index has broken down from its recent consolidation. The daily RSI (14) has entered a bearish crossover. On the lower end, a correction towards 22,500–22,400 looks possible in the short term, while on the higher end, 22,850 might continue to remain a strong resistance.”
reason: The article provides technical analysis of the Nifty index without mentioning specific companies.

title: F&O Talk: Nifty consolidates in narrow range; NR7 pattern signals impending directional move, says Sudeep Shah of SBI Securities
description: “In line with our expectation, after the formation of the Record Session Count candlestick pattern, the benchmark index Nifty has taken a breather in the last week. The index has traded in a narrow range of nearly 330 points, which was the lowest weekly range since the last week of December.”
reason: The news discusses technical analysis and market trends, which may not directly impact specific stocks but provides insight into broader market movements.

title: Tesla India entry a limited threat to Mahindra as de-rating priced in after 17% drop in share price: CLSA
description: Despite the hype over Tesla’s possible entry into India, CLSA contends that pricing constraints, import duties, and consumer preferences will limit its domestic influence. Positioned in the premium segment, Tesla’s base model currently costs around $35,000, far above India’s average car ASP of $14,000. Even with reduced import duties, its on-road price remains significantly higher than that of mass-market EVs.
reason: The news suggests that Tesla's entry into India could pose a limited threat to Mahindra, potentially affecting its stock price due to increased competition in the EV segment.

title: Concurrent Gainers: Vedanta among 8 stocks on a 5-day winning streak
description: Over the five trading sessions leading up to February 21, the Sensex declined by around 0.83%, losing 628 points to close at 75,311.
reason: The news highlights Vedanta's strong performance with a 5-day winning streak, indicating positive momentum for the stock.

title: Balrampur Chini Mills to set up PLA bio polymer unit in Uttar Pradesh
description: The ceremony was conducted by Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath
reason: The news indicates a strategic expansion by Balrampur Chini Mills, which could positively impact the company's stock due to potential revenue growth and diversification.
